definition[0]: a small book that advertises a school, college, new business etc
definition[1]: a document produced by a company that wants the public to buy its shares
definition[2]: a document produced by a company when inviting the public to buy its shares. By law, the company must include certain information in a prospectus, such as how the money is going to be used, what the chances of future success are etc
example[0]: The full prospectus for the share sale will be out next Thursday.
example[1]: Each year the college publishes a postgraduate prospectus which contains details of the degree courses offered.
